website_summaries.verdict: With an insulating neoprene core and rashguard-style arms, this convenient front-zip suit keeps swimmers warm in moderate climates.
pros: Front-zip suit is easier to get on and off than back-zip styles
One-piece swimsuit protects from cold, UV rays, and jellyfish
Sides and arms are made of rashguard material
cons: Sizing is a challenge, so be sure to measure carefully

customer_reviews.title: Sizing guidance needed
customer_reviews.text: It seemed like a nice suit, but it was FAR too large for my (small) 4-year-old. I ordered the Large (4/6) because I didn't want her to outgrow it instantly, but the crotch was down by her knees. She's about 37" tall and 30lbs, so a 2/4 might've been a better bet, but there wasn't any sizing guidance I could find beyond the age range. It would be nice if height/weight were correlated with sizes somewhere on the product description, so you could have a decent chance of choosing the right size.
customer_reviews.author: K. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Great for swimming pool
customer_reviews.text: Yes! Perfect for what I need. My son was literally shaking after 1 hour of swimming lesson. This keeps him comfortable throughout his lesson and gives spectacular freedom of movement.
customer_reviews.author: Bellini Francesca

customer_reviews.title: So far we love it. My son is 4
customer_reviews.text: So far we love it. My son is 4, 43 inches tall and 38 lbs. We ordered size Large. It fits him well with a little room to grow into. Hopefully it will last him through the summer (this is March).Fair price for the quality. It moves with the body really well, Does not restrict movement at all. Seams are well finished. Cressi kids is from the company Cressi Sub, they are top diving equipment makers.
customer_reviews.author: FrenchChef1

customer_reviews.title: Best bathing suit ever, comfy, sun protection, modest, durable
customer_reviews.text: Great price, fit true to size, comfortable, great sun protection. Got one for my 7yo daughter, one for my 4yo son, and one for my 3yo daughter. I used the size chart and picked the size recommended for their age - perfect fit. You can see in the pic I attached to this review.
customer_reviews.author: MrsJorgenson

customer_reviews.title: Size UP!
customer_reviews.text: I like them and so do the kids. Only reason I didn’t give 5 stars is because we have not been in the water with them yet and I want to wash them before I decide. I will say my son is in the green one, he is 52” and 60 pounds in the XXL and it is pretty short. According to their size chart he should actually fit the XL and that definitely would not have happened. My daughter is in the pink at 46” and 50 pounds in the XL. According to their chart she should wear the L but that clearly would not have happened so I say size UP!
customer_reviews.author: rachelle

customer_reviews.title: Good Thickness, Provides Added Warmth, Excellent Mobility
customer_reviews.text: I got a Medium for my almost 4 year old who is about 30 lbs. and between size 3T and 4T. The fit was a little loose but the length was perfect. I like the thickness as she is no longer shivering and miserable in swimming class (even though that pool is heated) and she is able to finally participate and make some progress. I like that it is still comfortable to run about and swim in and that the neck line is higher and provides more protection from the sun.
customer_reviews.author: MemlyTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Sizing too big
customer_reviews.text: I bought a large for my 5 1/2 year old daughter. She's tall and slim and this fit her very loose as it does in the product picture. This can make swimming challenging and it kind of defeats the purpose because cold water can easily flow in and out. I read another review where the sizing was too small. If you have a skinny kid, go down one, if you have a huskier kid, go up one I guess. Or, buy 1 down, 1 up and 1 on the money and return the two that don't fit.
customer_reviews.author: H.B.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent fit, quality and look
customer_reviews.text: My LO loves it, the pool we visit is usually coldish - luke warm so I have been looking to dress her up a little more and this absolutely does the trick. She is also squirmish about new textures being "itchy", but the Cressi Kids Swimsuit is seamless on the inside and all materials are soft enough for her skin. Additionally, we purchased the Large size (age 4/6), she is 5yo, aproximately 42" and 38lb, there is room to grow in the Cressi Swimsuit, but it is a good fit, I would not consider buying a smaller size.
customer_reviews.author: W. S. Flores

customer_reviews.title: Not a wetsuit!!@
customer_reviews.text: There a foul plastic smell that I can't get rid of no matter how many times i wash it, with different detergents too. It still smells bad, even after months of usage in a chlorinated pool. It's also quite loose on my 3yo, and the mesh panels on the side really don't help to keep my kids warm. It's thin, Don't expect it to work like a wetsuit.
customer_reviews.author: H. Luu

customer_reviews.title: we’ve only used it once because he had a weird line of what looks like a friction burn across his thighs- presumably from the ...
customer_reviews.text: We were excited to get a lined suit that would help our 2.5yr old son remain in the pool for his 30m lesson. This seemed to keep him warm, he wasn’t ready to get out early and his lips remained a healthy shade of pink. However, we’ve only used it once because he had a weird line of what looks like a friction burn across his thighs- presumably from the bottom hem of the shorts where the material is thicker. It took over a week to go away. Perhaps the fit was to blame but I was completely surprised by it since everything looked like it fit him well!
customer_reviews.author: Sully

customer_reviews.title: Fit is just right for 31 month old boy, good price and It does what's supposed to.
customer_reviews.text: the item came new, with a Cressi label attached to the suit inside a clear bag with an Amazon warehouse sticker on it. First time buyer for a "like new" item. The size small blue, fits just right and only good for this summer, but that's ok because I want it to fit correctly now not next year. Please hit helpful to encourage more independent reviews like this one.
customer_reviews.author: Rixxy

customer_reviews.title: Very Cute
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this seems very good. Especially when you consider the price. My daughter is 4 and thin but tall. The large was a little loose but not bad. It will definitely fit all summer even if she has another growth spurt. Can’t speak for the sun protection because my daughter has never had a problem with burning, but it keeps her much warmer when getting out of the water. No more shivering like crazy! Color matches pictures nicely. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: WilsonFamily

customer_reviews.title: good quality, but a bit snug
customer_reviews.text: PROS: -Daughter loves the colors, very stylish - We have used it in both the swimming pool and open sea, and it has worked very well in keeping her warm and is very buoyant. - The fabric is nice and thick, with no tears or fraying so far. CONS: - the fit is very snug. She's tall -- the sleeves are the perfect length, but the torso is a bit too short, so it ends up too high on the backside; we'll have to size up soon. - strong PU smell - it does off-gas a bit, even after a dozen wears.
customer_reviews.author: Herald

customer_reviews.title: Great to keep kiddos warm during swim lessons, love the material on sleeves and sides!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my kids to help keep them warm during swim lessons in the winter months. Other kids are turning blue and shivering... and mine are shivering some but seem more comfortable than most. I love that the neoprene is in the middle of the wet suit, but the arms and sides are regular bathing suit material so it feels more like a bathing suit to them and has more flexibility in the water. I used the size chart for both kids and the sizes worked for them.
customer_reviews.author: matt d

customer_reviews.title: I love it! This was exactly what I was looking ...
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfectly! I love it! This was exactly what I was looking for it fits her perfectly it keeps her warm she no longer gets blue lips or shivers she can be in this all day and it keeps her warm in the water. And it looks super cute on her and she can move around easily. My daughter is 33" long and weighs 24lbs I got the size small.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Good swimming outfit keeps the body warm
customer_reviews.text: My 5 years old grandson wears it for his swimming classes and doesn't shiver any more in the cold pool water. This outfit allows him to jump and swim freely. Higley recommended. He is wearing x-large.
customer_reviews.author: Cool buyer

customer_reviews.title: Keeps kids warmer in the pool
customer_reviews.text: My daughter used to last ten minutes in the pool before her lips would turn blue and she’d be over it. Now she makes it through the whole 30 minute lesson and she still feels nice and warm. I got the pink one based on other reviews which said the pink was thicker. I would have gotten blue otherwise, and I honestly don’t know if the pink is thicker because I’ve only seen the pink. But she loves it and it’s easy so I’m really glad we got it and when she grows out of it we will buy the next size up.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Jones

customer_reviews.title: good quality, fits as expected. happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: bought this for my 4 year old, and it fits him great, with a little room for growth. Matches his Cressi snorkel set so he was stoked about that! lol My only complaint would be that the light blue parts are actually a spandex type fabric, not neoprene, which is not a great insulator. I wish it was all neoprene so it would keep him warmer in cool water, though it is better than nothing! Has extended our swimming season in the chilly above ground pool lol
customer_reviews.author: Jen Downey

customer_reviews.title: Nice suit, not complete neoprene
customer_reviews.text: Nice suit but I wish I'd noticed it's not 100 neoprene. The nylon sides somewhat defeat the actual purpose of buying a "wet suit." It added some warmth for swimming lessons, but I was expecting full neoprene. Not sure what the description said and I may have presumed the nylon was used for some other purpose in the suit. Regardless, my son loves it, and it's a nice suit otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: I love the smooth, stretchy fabric. The front zipper makes for easy on and off. The XXL size fits perfectly on a boy who is about 53" tall and 70 pounds and 11 years old. It will keep him warm while swimming in the ocean during the summer. We purchased smaller sizes of this same wetsuit in the past and have always been happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Trisha

customer_reviews.title: nice for chilly water
customer_reviews.text: It has a cool look, and takes the edge off when the water (or air) is chilly. My kids like wearing them when they want to keep swimming as the sun goes down, the clouds roll in, or the water is just a bit chilly. It's not like a full-body wetsuit, so it doesn't make a huge difference in keeping them warm, just takes the edge off and makes it easier to get in the water.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Sommers

customer_reviews.title: This is a tick swimsuite, not diving quality one
customer_reviews.text: 4 stars for keeping the child warm - yes, but not as thick neoprene would do. Plus it doesn't fit snug, so water flows inside between swimsuite and body. This is a nice sun and wind protection swimsuite. Not neoprene like diving suits, but very very thin. This was perfect for all day at the pool/beach and it is very good for swim lessons. Allows free movements. Sizing is true to age.
customer_reviews.author: Aleksandar T.

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE SMELL-
customer_reviews.text: This would be a great product except it smells terrible, outgassing plastic at its WORST. And the smell doesn't go away no matter how many times we wash it. And if you accidentally put it in the dryer (like we did after we had it more than a week) it will stink up your dryer and any loads of laundry afterwards with a heavy toxic plastic smell..
customer_reviews.author: Mamamama

customer_reviews.title: Great suit
customer_reviews.text: My son had a great one piece suit from LL Bean that he grew out of this year and they don't make a larger size. So I was on the hunt to find a replacement and ended up buying this one and I am really happy with it. The dark blue portion is thicker like wet suit material, but the light blue portion is typical bathing suit fabric. I like that it is slightly sturdier, but doesn't feel like a full wet suit since we are just using it for swimming lessons and days at the lake. He has worn it a bunch so far this year and it is holding up fine. I'm happy! (And so is he!)
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Saved Swim Lessons
customer_reviews.text: I signed up for August swim lessons...and somehow my kiddo was still shivering 10min into the lesson and wanting to quit. I got this and it totally saved the day! He was warm enough to pay attention, but it's thin and flexible enough that it didn't hamper his movements.
customer_reviews.author: WiscoMom

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Suit
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandson who tends to get cold in the pool quickly. Since he has been wearing the suit, he has stayed in the pool much longer because he does not get cold than with his swim trunks. Fits him perfectly, he is 7 almost 8, he loves the suit!
customer_reviews.author: Kellyf143

customer_reviews.title: Cute look but hard to get out of
customer_reviews.text: Great idea but has a few flaws. First, the front zipper makes it difficult for kids to remove this on their own over their shoulders once wet. Second, the lighter material at the sleeves and thighs gaps for super skinny kids and makes this not keep them very warm. My bigger daughter likes hers, but my stick-thin son was still cold.
customer_reviews.author: chertheatr

customer_reviews.title: M size fit w/ room to grow / 28 lbs 34.5 inches
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Medium size fit her with room to grow. She was 28 lbs 34.5 inches. She was 19 months old in the photo. The packaging was bad. It came in a ripped and super wrinkled poly bag. The tag was Detached from the clothes. It was apparent that it was someone's return. The wetsuit looked too narrow, but it has to in order to keep the warmth of my baby. She tried it on. It fit well. She looks so cute in it.
customer_reviews.author: sapphira

customer_reviews.title: Wetsuit material, thick yet comfy.
customer_reviews.text: Fit my very thin and tall almost 5 year old. Kept her pretty warm during our vacation at a resort park. It had a funky smell, but it helped to air it out before wearing. She said it was comfortable, this means a lot coming from a kid who complains about tags and seams. She will probably outgrow it soon, then we will just pass it along to the next kid. Very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Nakamo

customer_reviews.title: Zipper Malfunction
customer_reviews.text: This little suit is actually pretty cute and the sizing is pretty accurate. However, two weeks after it arrived the zipper split at the base of the suit. Life is hectic and as of today I’m a few days “past return” the company won’t allow me to even exchange the item that I paid for. A malfunction that isn’t a fault of my kiddo.
customer_reviews.author: Mariah Arjona

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my 3yrd old daughter. We have a non heated pool and this thing keeps her warm enough to stay inside the pool for about 30-45 minutes. The stitched and seems are really well done and overall quality seems really good. The zipper has an inner lining (and long flap on the inside), so no complains about zipper scratching.
customer_reviews.author: vc

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Eh.. small in the crotch and still too big for my skinny preemie toddler. Didn't see any difference between this and a $5 Target swimsuit in warmth at the cold New England beach. Also began to show signs of wear after two hours of light use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for little ones!
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough good about these suits. I live in NE Tennessee where the summer might be sweltering and it might be cool. This year has been off to a cooler start and these suits were wonderful for my grandchildren. Ages 3 and 1, it made all the difference for them in the big pool. Even running around the sprinkler or in the kiddie pool, these keep their core much warmer. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a lot of protection.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and the neosport wetsuit. This one is just too thin in my opinion and doesn't seem like it will offer much protection from the cold (the sides and arms are just regular spandex material similar to a rashguard). For a similar price the neosport kids wetsuit has more protection and I recommend that one.
customer_reviews.author: Szu

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect in hot beach & pool weather
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect in hot beach & pool weather! My kid had no sunburn, could play in the sand without piling or tear, and it’s easy to get in/out of; also, very reasonably priced. Like other parents have said, I, too, appreciate this style's modesty while still being functional and comfortable. The first one has held up well enough to hand down to my second kiddo, and I'm definitely ordering another one for backup.
customer_reviews.author: SeptemberMama

customer_reviews.title: otherwise I would recommend getting one size up
customer_reviews.text: Its ok. The material is not thick all over just in the trunk and leg areas, the other areas are very thin and offers no protection from cold water, that was disappointing. If your child is on the smaller side for their height and weight then the sizing would work, otherwise I would recommend getting one size up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: tight and kind of short, size up maybe?
customer_reviews.text: I have a chunky little one so I didnt have the problems others did with the lose legs. However mine also has a belly and I felt that the swimsuit was tight there, squishing even. Also I got 3/4 for a tall 2 year old and I don't think it will fit next year, I think if I size up it will be too lose
customer_reviews.author: calicanuck

customer_reviews.title: It's Ok
customer_reviews.text: I purchased size XX-Large for my 10 year old daughter. My daughter weight and height is below US average. Still this swim suit is about 1/2 size smaller. She probably can only wear it this summer. I drop 2 stars for this reason. Otherwise, the fabric, tailoring and finish meet my expectation.
customer_reviews.author: Adolfox

customer_reviews.title: Not too bad
customer_reviews.text: Disclaimer - Boy age - 7.5years old. Weight - 25kg. I order a xxl for my boy. It is very fitting. I would say that should he grow any larger, he is left with no space. he had been wearing this swimsuit for the past 3 months, well at least, todate, He could still fit in easily. During cool days (i.e. 28 deg - cloudy), after dipping into the pool, he will jump up saying that the water is cold. thus I wonder how "thermal" is this swimsuit.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Lim

customer_reviews.title: Warm but not enough
customer_reviews.text: Keeps her a little warmer but not much... I read all the reviews, thinking this was the one. But I wish I had gotten the all neoprene suit. Bummer
customer_reviews.author: Katelin Fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: fits 15 month old perfect
customer_reviews.text: My 15 month old fits perfect in it and it works! Kept him warm while swimming in an outdoor pool that was not warmed. He looks super cute in it too.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Bernhardt

customer_reviews.title: Helped with temp regulation.
customer_reviews.text: Love this suit. My daughter gets cold easily, so I was looking for something thicker than a bathing suit. She weighs 35lbs and is 38in tall. The size large is loose, but it works for her. Tested it out at the waterpark & she did much better with temperature regulation in wind. Color is more rich than the picture & it looks great!
customer_reviews.author: M. McClure

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 6 year old daughter's swim classes. She's a little taller than other girls her age, so I usually order clothing items in a size up because of her height. The fit was a little tight buying the "Large." It would have worked for next months classes assuming she didn't grow at all. I ended up sending it back because the arms and neck are not neoprene and I want an all neoprene suit to keep her warm in the cooler water. This would have been "okay" if there weren't any other options.
customer_reviews.author: O. Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Great for summer play
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 2.5 year old, and although it's a tadbit big (he's also on the smaller side), it works great for our non-heated pool. Excellent material to keep him warm, well made overall, will by the next size up once he's ready for it!
customer_reviews.author: C. Charles

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SUIT!!!

customer_reviews.author: S Gibson

customer_reviews.title: But it smells bad, even after 3 washes
customer_reviews.text: Seems to keep our little man warm at the pool, which is why I bought this suit. But it smells bad, even after 3 washes. If smell doesn't go away in next week or so, I might return this suit.
customer_reviews.author: svetikrusa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: Son LOVED his bodysuit! For a boy who is always cold, this really helped him get into the somewhat cold water and truly enjoyed himself!! With a front zipper - which seemed to be comfortable, it was easy to put on and easy to remove. Great protection from the sun, dries fast and most importantly - our kid was comfortable!! Totally recommend this product!!
customer_reviews.author: Casa De Oro

customer_reviews.title: The suit is great though, just not perfect for us
customer_reviews.text: The neoprene is thin, and the sleeves are made out of a lycra swim material. This works well for our daughter during warmer months or in warmer pools, but she will need something with more coverage. The suit is great though, just not perfect for us.
customer_reviews.author: K. Moriwaki

customer_reviews.title: Nice Fit
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is 3, 38" tall and 40 lb. I ordered the large age 4-6 suit and it fits her fine. I ordered this as a back up extra suit to an O'Neill and I think it should work fine for that.
customer_reviews.author: Jlloyd

customer_reviews.title: Looks great and kept my son warm while other kids were ...

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I love the way it suits into my son’s body. He is so comfortable wearing it and that is what it matters

customer_reviews.title: Heat helper perfect size 4t
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is a micropreemie with cerebral palsy, but she doesn't let it hold her back! Except that she is 3.5, and is still underweight, and gets cold pretty easily. customer_reviews.title: XXL too small for my large 6 year old

Both have room to grow. They smell a bit weird, but they are so effective I don't care.
customer_reviews.author: Akauf

customer_reviews.title: Good fit & quality

customer_reviews.author: JoeyBaggz

product_meta.title: Cressi KIDS SWIMSUIT, 1.5mm Neoprene Suit Boys and Girls - Cressi: Quality since 1946
product_meta.description: "One-piece swimsuit for little children ideal for any kind of water activity. It is a must-have for the swimming pool or to go snorkeling in the sea. The sides, the collar, and the sleeves are made of Elastane, an elastic fabric that works like a second skin, protecting against the harmful sun ray (UVA - UVB) and against jellyfishes. The front and the back part are made of 1.5 mm Neoprene to ensure warmth and to offer an extra protection against cold, perfect in case of prolonged water exposure or in windy days. The front zip (made of the quality YKK) makes easy the donning and doffing. The Swimsuit is designed for kids aged between 2 to 10 years old, refer to the size chart to get approximately the most suitable size for the child. The product is like a second skin, it is normal to feel it tight when worn. Rinse with clear water and let completely dry after use. The Kids Swimsuit is designed in Italy by Cressi and made in China. Cressi has been a brand pioneer in Scuba Diving, Snorkeling, and Swimming equipment since 1946. The product is covered by a 2-year limited warranty."
